attributes.action: Push for more research into Brain tumours
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There needs to be more research undertaken into investigating the aetiology and treatment of brain tumours, particularly high grade tumours.There are a large number of types of cancers and funding needs to be equitable. However the morbidity and mortality needs to be taken into consideration when funding is allocated. In areas where a lot of money has been spent- eg Leukaemia the prognosis and outcomes have improved over the last two decades. On the other hand with brain tumours this does not appear to be the case. 
Facts:    
 * More children die from a brain tumour than any other cancer
    *  3,400 people lose their lives to a brain tumour each year
    * On average 75% of all childhood cancer patients in Britain survive five years, only 65% of children diagnosed with a high grade brain tumour live for longer than this
    * In adults, with a malignant brain tumour, only 14% living longer than 5 years
    * 40% of all cancer deaths in children are from a brain tumour
    * The number of people dying from a brain tumour has increased - incidence increases by approximately 2% per year
    * On average it takes longer to diagnose a child with a brain tumour in the UK than in North America.
Please support brain tumour research.
